subject: Productivity
title: The Rise of the To-Do List
description: A fast breakdown of The Rise of the To-Do List for builders.

hook.text: The oldest known to-do list dates back to ancient Mesopotamia. Clay tablets listed daily tasks.

buildup.text: To-do lists gained modern popularity in the 1900s as business culture embraced written planning.

discovery.text: Research shows writing tasks down reduces anxiety. The brain stops looping on unfinished business.

twist.text: But most to-do lists fail. People add more than they finish, creating guilt instead of progress.

climax.text: The best lists are short, prioritized, and connected to deadlines. Length kills effectiveness.

punchline.text: A short list beats a long one every time.

quiz.question: Why does writing tasks down reduce anxiety according to research?
options: The brain stops looping on unfinished business
